page.title: 07EMPLOYMENT AND INDUSTRY
page.content: There are not many opportunities for employment. Farming is the principal occupation, supplemented by the few small businesses listed, e.g. market garden, haulage, agricultural workshops, camp and caravan site, dog kennels, plant hire and landscape contractor and storekeeping in the six hangars - relics from the second world war dispersed airfields. Some of the inhabitants work at RAPRA or RAF Shawbury, and others at the nearby MOTEC establishment. Farmers tend to train their sons - usually the eldest - to take over some of their duties, and eventually all of them. Most farms now are gradually reducing their work force due to mechanisation.
